concept.title: Mask Types
concept.shortdesc: You can use the following mask types to mask data:

dlentry.dd: Replaces values with a fixed-length mask. Use when you want to mask any variability in length in the data.

The following example uses a fixed-length masks to hide passwords:
Password (original) Password (fixed-length mask)
1234
donKey
022367snowballrocks asd302kd0
2v03msO3d
L92m1sN3q
Replaces values with a variable-length mask. Use when you want to reveal the different lengths of the original data.

The following example uses a variable length mask to hide the same passwords:
Password (original) Password (variable-length mask)
1234
donKey
022367snowballrocks asd3
2v03ms
L92m1sN3q0jaOmE67Ws

Replaces values with a mask based on a user-defined pattern. When you define the pattern for the mask, you can use the following special characters:
Hash mark (#) - Reveals the original character in that location.
checking with Hari
All other characters are used as constants in the mask. For example, the following mask pattern reveals the area code of a phone number: ###-xxx-xxxx.
